TEXT.English: A single resource will provide less happiness, health, or production speed as your population grows. Large empires may require two or even three of the same kind to satisfy their populace.
Technology advancement will improve the efficiency ratios for all your resources. Don't neglect cheaper, older technologies.
The production penalty for resource shortage is only halved compared to health and happiness penalties.
The bow symbol next to the movement points denotes a unit's range. All units capable of dealing collateral damage use their superior range to attack the enemy safely from afar.
To have a chance at killing an attacking collateral damage unit, keep a unit with equal or higher range in your stack.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketmen[COLOR_REVERT] do not ignore [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Walls[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castles[COLOR_REVERT] are powerful defensive tools until cannons are invented.
Modern artillery, bombers and ships can all destroy buildings.
The AI carefully evaluates if using nuclear weapons might result in a nuclear counter-attack, and stick to conventional warfare otherwise.
When at war, sea units can only move two tiles into enemy territory per turn.
Only when your rivals are pleased with you will they sign an open border agreement.
When a religion is driven out of your city, all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temples[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] of that religion are destroyed in the process.
If your unique unit requires [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT] you can be sure to have one near your starting position.
The global community frowns upon the usage of nuclear weapons... unless it is on their enemies.
[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Civ4 Reimagined[COLOR_REVERT] is best played with 18 players, "new world" continent, and no technology trading.
Technologies that found religions are cheaper after they have been discovered by someone else.
State religion can be switched without anarchy, but you need to wait 20 turns before you can switch again!
You need [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sailing[COLOR_REVERT] to connect river resources without roads.
Cities with enough culture cannot be razed.
Beware of pirates!

There are two ways to gain [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slavery[COLOR_REVERT]. First is to conquer enemy cities. Second is to settle on large oversea continents after discovery of [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomy[COLOR_REVERT].
[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporations[COLOR_REVERT] spread automatically to cities with suitable resources nearby.

You can get the newest stable version at [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]forums.civfanatics.com[COLOR_REVERT] or the newest development version at [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]github.com/pbatr/Civ4-Reimagined[COLOR_REVERT]. We are always happy to hear your feedback!
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] don't count towards the worker limit. Use them to modernize a large empire.
All deals and treaties last double as long as before.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Scouts[COLOR_REVERT] are better at fighting wildlife than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warriors[COLOR_REVERT], especially [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bears[COLOR_REVERT].
Recommended settings for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Civ4 Reimagined[COLOR_REVERT]: 18-20 players totestra map. Empty, colonizeable continent ("new world"). No technology trading.
Oversea colonies will eventually grow unhappy. There are several ways to deal with it. One of them is to release them and keep them as a vassal instead.
Chopping forests is a lot less efficient without [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Replacable Parts[COLOR_REVERT]. Consider keeping some of your forests until then.
Early ships can move into rival territory without open border agreements. Be sure to make use of them to establish trade routes and to keep an eye on your opponents.
Collateral units cannot damage units below 85% hp, but that is often enough to tilt the odds in your favor.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fighters[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jet Fighters[COLOR_REVERT] can destroy units! They are especially effective against ships.
The number of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] is limited to give larger empires a tougher time, but if you don't like that, you can change it in the game settings before game starts.
Constructing wooden ships benefits more from chopping nearby forests.
Attackers only benefit from superior range (small bow symbol) if they are dealing collateral damage.
The impact of tech diffusion will be very low unless you play with technology trading turned off (recommended).

The profit you gain from spreading the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East India Company[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal African Company[COLOR_REVERT] to your cities will increase with every [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slave[COLOR_REVERT] in your empire.

The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East India Company[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal African Company[COLOR_REVERT] require coastal cities and can spread only while you maintain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slavery[COLOR_REVERT].
You gain a small fraction of your vassals' research, gold, and espionage.
Your vassals give you a small portion of their gold, research, and espionage. Let them prosper and you will be rewarded.
Unhappy cities are more likely to start a revolt.
With the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT], you can hire units even if you are lacking the required resources. For a price, of course...
If you abolish slavery, all [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] in your empire will be freed.
